plugins.name: Free Arabic Translation: RTL Localization & Layout Support (Translate 180+ languages)
plugins.description:
Free Arabic Translation & RTL UI Localization Support at Your Fingertips


This comprehensive plugin bridges the language gap with seamless Arabic translation and RTL support for Figma designs. Convert selected text from any of 180+ languages to properly formatted Arabic text, enabling effective communication with Arabic-speaking communities worldwide.


Key Features:


  1. Fast and accurate translations with automatic language detection
  2. Complete text handling for sections, layers, art boards, frames, groups, components and instances
  3. Proper Arabic glyph reshaping and bidirectional text support
  4. RTL layout transformation capabilities for complete design localization
  5. Line wrapping support for multi-line Arabic text
  6. Preserves original text for future edits and developer handoff
  7. Font switching options optimized for Arabic typography
  8. User-friendly interface designed for efficiency


Use Cases:


  1. Translate designs for Arabic-speaking clients or customers
  2. QA localized designs in RTL to ensure flawless UX across geographies
  3. Communicate with Arabic-speaking colleagues or team members
  4. Learn Arabic and improve your language skills
  5. Connect with Arabic-speaking communities and cultures worldwide
  6. Create Arabic-themed design systems
  7. Convert entire layouts from LTR to RTL with a single click
  8. Maintain design consistency across language versions
  9. Improve the global outreach of your app and business to Arabic speaking countries


Download the Arabic Translation & RTL Support Plugin today and create authentic Arabic experiences in your designs with ease


Support:

Email contact@clarityux.in for support and assistance.

accepted.description: ClarityUX is a DesignOps automation platform that streamlines the design review process with predictive analysis, boosting quality and saving designers 15-20hrs

plugins.name: Variables Usage Counter
plugins.description:
Variable Usage Counter is an essential Figma plugin that empowers designers by providing detailed insights into the usage of variables across their projects. Whether you're dealing with colors, strings, or numerical values, this plugin helps you maintain consistency and efficiency by tracking how and where your variables are utilized.


Key Features:

  1. In-Depth Variable Analysis: Effortlessly scan your entire Figma document to collect comprehensive data on variable usage, including the frequency of use and specific locations within your design.
  2. User-Friendly Interface: Navigate through your variables with ease using an intuitive UI that allows filtering by usage status (used/unused) and type (color, string, number).
  3. Flexible Viewing Options: Choose between a structured view, which organizes variables by their collection, or a flat view for a straightforward list of all variables.
  4. Real-Time Feedback: Stay informed with instant updates on scanning progress and results, ensuring you always have the latest information at your fingertips.
  5. Node Highlighting: Quickly identify and highlight nodes in your design that utilize specific variables, facilitating informed design decisions.
  6. Seamless Integration: Enjoy a smooth and responsive UI that integrates effortlessly into your Figma workflow.


Variable Usage Count is the perfect tool for designers and teams aiming to maintain a high level of organization and consistency in their projects. By offering a clear overview of variable usage, this plugin helps optimize your design workflow and ensures that your projects are both efficient and visually cohesive.
plugins.tagline: Find, Count & Analyze variable usage effortlessly

plugins.name: GeneXus Design Assistant
plugins.description:
GeneXus Design Assistant is a revolutionary Figma plugin that seamlessly integrates with GeneXus using Generative Artificial Intelligence, allowing you to accelerate and optimize the application design process. With GeneXus Design Assistant, you can generate a fully functional application, leveraging the modeling capabilities and the power of GeneXus and GeneXus Next.


Optimizing the design process


GeneXus Design Assistant is aimed at designers who want to turn vibrant ideas into cutting-edge digital products without requiring programming skills.


The benefits include:


🚀 Rapid Prototyping and Testing: Quickly validate assumptions, explore alternatives, and develop functional MVPs, leveraging the robust capabilities of Generative Artificial Intelligence models, modeling in Figma, and GeneXus.


✨ Improved Communication and Collaboration: Designs and ideas are shared in real-time throughout the company, aligning interdisciplinary considerations into a shared vision of success.


🛠️ Scalable and Maintainable Solutions: Facilitates responding to the exact needs of a constantly evolving business environment, all through a unified and future-proof platform.


📱 Democratization of Design: Reduces bottlenecks by involving non-specialized team members at various project levels, fostering innovation, and streamlining workflows.


What is the GeneXus Design Assistant project?


GeneXus Design Assistant is a public Figma plugin, serving as an innovative assistant for application design. With GeneXus Design Assistant, designers can expedite the collaborative creation of software experiences, keeping a keen focus on end users. Functioning as a comprehensive assistant within Figma, GeneXus Design Assistant guides designers through the process of conceptualizing, designing, and prototyping web and mobile applications using Generative Artificial Intelligence.


GeneXus Design Assistant makes this possible by generating design from a data model and example data, both sourced from a GeneXus knowledge base, and utilizing a predefined, customizable design system. The generated design has the advantage of being importable into GeneXus, ensuring a seamless integration with the platform and allowing the creative process to easily translate into a functional software product.


USAGE


Please refer to GeneXus Design Assistant for Figma.


SUPPORT


Your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions for improvement are welcome and highly valued. Connect with us at GeneXus Support.

accepted.name: GeneXus DesignOps Team
accepted.description: GeneXus workspace specialized in integrating design into GeneXus knowledge base.

plugins.tagline: Plugin that seamlessly integrates with GeneXus using Generative Artificial Intelligence

plugins.name: Pixel Round
plugins.description:
Pixel Round is your go-to tool for achieving pixel-perfect precision in your Figma designs. Say goodbye to messy decimal values in dimensions, padding, text, and more. Pixel Round automatically rounds off values to the nearest whole number, ensuring your designs are always crisp, clean, and consistent.


How It Works:


  1. Install the Plugin: Start by adding Pixel Round to your Figma workspace.
  2. Select Your Frame or Element: Open the plugin and select a frame, group, component, or any design element that you want to perfect.
  3. Analyze the Selection: Pixel Round will instantly show a preview of your selection and check for any decimal issues in dimensions, padding, corner radii, stroke weights, text, and auto-layout settings.
  4. Click "Apply": The "Apply" button will round off all decimal values, including width, height, padding, corner radii, and stroke weight.
  5. Enjoy the Perfection: Once the process is complete, Pixel Round will notify you that your design is now pixel perfect!
plugins.tagline: Perfect your pixels effortlessly.

plugins.name: Import Figma brand guideline designs into Corebook° — online brand guidelines platform
plugins.description:
Corebook° Figma Plugin


Streamline how designers connect their work with the brand.


The Corebook° Figma plugin makes it easy to import Figma-designed brand guideline modules directly into Corebook°, with instant update push functionality. It also supports two-way integration—allowing you to seamlessly import and export brand assets, color palettes, and typography between Corebook° and Figma.


What can this plugin do?


Figma frames. In Corebook°. Instantly.

With a single click bring your custom design Figma content framers into fully functional Corebook° modules– without the need of exporting, uploading or file conversions. Every design element is transferred pixel-perfect and still retains text recognition for easy select-copy, adding hover state asset or attaching assets for download.


Real-time updates, zero re-exports.

Seamlessly sync your Figma content frames with Corebook°—no extra steps, no re-uploads. Updating an existing module takes just one click, keeping everything effortlessly up to date.


Your assets, ready in Figma.

Designers in Figma can now access all brand assets directly from the Corebook° Asset Library—no switching tabs, no extra steps. Keep design and non-design teams aligned with a single source of truth for every brand asset.


Your designs, saved where they belong.

Not adding live content frames? No problem. Export your Figma designs—or just specific elements—straight to the Corebook° Asset Library, all without leaving Figma.


Brand styles, applied instantly.

Forget manual brand typography and color style setups—create local Figma styles automatically from your brand guidelines on Corebook°. No more redoing what’s already done. No more human errors.


Getting started with the Corebook° x Figma Plugin


To begin, create a project in Corebook° and link it with your Figma file through the plugin interface on Figma. Then follow two step process to get started your brand designs:


Designing in Figma – create your brand guidelines module using a Figma content frame from the plugin dashboard. This is where the content you’ll bring into Corebook° will be.


Set up a Figma module in Corebook° – Inside your Corebook° project, create a Figma module—this is where your design from Figma will be displayed.


Layout Size Recommendations

When not using placeholder content frames, then for the best results, please keep these layout size recommendations in mind:

  1. Desktop layout width: 1070px
  2. Mobile layout width: 375px


Or create a custom column size within a multi-column grid. Check Figma module placeholders in the Corebook° Editor for specific sizing guidance.


For any questions or feedback please contact us: figma@corebook.io


---

Corebook° is an online brand guidelines platform that gets your branding processes in order and means business.
plugins.tagline: Build guidelines, import brand assets, and create local Figma styles automatically!

plugins.name: Design Checker
plugins.description:
# Design Checker 3.0 for Figma


**Smart design validation with platform-aware recommendations**


Design Checker 3.0 brings intelligent analysis to your Figma workflow. The plugin now understands whether you're designing for mobile, tablet, or desktop and provides relevant suggestions for each platform.


## What's New in Version 3.0


### 🎯 **Platform Detection**

- Automatically detects mobile, tablet, or desktop designs based on frame width

- Shows platform-specific recommendations instead of generic advice

- Visual indicator shows which platform was detected


### ⚙️ **Customizable Analysis**

- Turn analysis categories on/off based on your project needs

- Choose between strict or flexible Material Design compliance

- Tabs automatically hide when categories are disabled


### 📱 **Better Mobile Support**

- Mobile-specific touch target recommendations

- Thumb zone analysis for mobile interfaces

- Mobile-first accessibility checks


### 🎨 **Improved Interface**

- Streamlined header with integrated search

- Advanced search by measurements, colors, fonts, and object types

- Better filtering and organization


## Key Features


**Design System Validation**

- Grid alignment and spacing consistency

- Typography and color system compliance

- Component sizing and layout checks


**Accessibility & Standards**

- WCAG 2.2 touch target validation

- Material Design 3 guidelines (optional)

- SEO-friendly content hierarchy


**Performance Optimization**

- Core Web Vitals considerations

- Image sizing and layout stability

- Performance impact warnings


## Who Should Use This


- **UI/UX Designers** working on responsive designs

- **Design Teams** maintaining consistency across platforms

- **Mobile-First Projects** requiring platform-specific validation

- **Accessibility-Focused Teams** ensuring inclusive design


## How It Works


1. Select any frame or component in Figma

2. Plugin automatically detects your design platform

3. Get instant, relevant feedback for your specific context

4. Customize which checks to run through settings

5. Fix issues with actionable, platform-aware suggestions


## Why Upgrade to 3.0


- **Smarter Recommendations**: Get advice that matches your actual design context

- **Save Time**: Focus on issues that matter for your platform

- **Better Mobile UX**: Ensure your mobile designs meet usability standards

- **Flexible Analysis**: Only run the checks you need for your project


---


**Ready to improve your design validation process?**


Install Design Checker 3.0 and experience smarter, context-aware design analysis.

plugins.name: 调色师 Color Palette Filler
plugins.description:
Introduction

“Color Palette Filler” allows you to quickly apply colors from a predefined palette to any selected element in Figma. Simplify your design workflow by adding vibrant colors with just a click.


Function Description

•Predefined color groups: 8 colors, 12 colors, 16 colors, 20 colors, 24 colors, 28 colors, 32 colors.

•Instantly apply selected colors to the fill of elements.

•User-friendly interface for quick access to your color needs.


How to Use

1.Select one or more elements in Figma.

2.Open the “Color Palette Filler” plugin.

3.Click on any color from the palette to apply it to the selected elements.


Notes

•Make sure the selected elements can accept fill properties.

•The plugin applies solid colors only.


介绍

“Color Palette Filler” 插件允许您快速将预定义色板中的颜色应用于 Figma 中的任何选定元素。只需点击一下，即可轻松为设计添加丰富的颜色，简化您的设计工作流程。


功能说明

•预定义的颜色分组：8色、12色、16色、20色、24色、28色、32色。

•即时将选定颜色应用于元素的填充。

•用户友好的界面，可快速访问您的颜色需求。


使用方法

1.在 Figma 中选择一个或多个元素。

2.打开 “Color Palette Filler” 插件。

3.点击色板中的任意颜色，将其应用于选定的元素。


注意事项

•请确保选定的元素可以接受填充属性。

•插件仅应用纯色。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: Apply palette colors to Figma elements instantly. Simplify your design process.

“Color Palette Filler” 插件允许您快速将预定义色板中的颜色应用于 Figma 中的任何选定元素。只需点击一下，即可轻松为设计添加丰富的颜色，简化您的设计工作流程。


功能说明

•预定义的颜色分组：8色、12色、16色、20色、24色、28色、32色。

•即时将选定颜色应用于元素的填充。

•用户友好的界面，可快速访问您的颜色需求。


使用方法

1.在 Figma 中选择一个或多个元素。

2.打开 “Color Palette Filler” 插件。

3.点击色板中的任意颜色，将其应用于选定的元素。


注意事项

•请确保选定的元素可以接受填充属性。

•插件仅应用纯色。
137674.tagline: Apply palette colors to Figma elements instantly. Simplify your design process.

plugins.name: VariableScout
plugins.description:
VariableScout


The Essential Power Tool for Streamlined Variable Management. Effortlessly visualize, organize, and optimize your variables and nodes with various features designed to supercharge your workflow.


Core Features


  1. Variable Tracking: Comprehensive overview of all variables and their connections to nodes in your documents page
  2. Smart Filtering: Filter variables by type (Color, Number, Text, Boolean) and nodes by category (Components, Instances, Frames, Text, Shapes)
  3. Search System: Lightweight search functionality to quickly find specific variables, nodes, or collections
  4. Node Selection: Select individual nodes, multiple nodes, or entire path segments directly from the plugin to canvas
  5. Real-time Selection: Automatically updates to show variables connected to your selected nodes on canvas
  6. View Options: Only Unused Variables: Focus on variables not currently used in your document, Only Selected Nodes: Show variables only for nodes selected on canvas, Merge Collections: Combine all variables into a single, streamlined view, Hide Hidden Layers: Filter out variables connected to hidden layers, Focused View: Simplified display of variable values and node paths
  7. Customizable Export: Export your filtered and searched variables in JSON or CSV format - what you see is what you export
  8. Variable Swapping: Easily swap variables across multiple selected nodes simultaneously
  9. Collection Management: View and organize variables from both local and library collections


Key Benefits


  1. Time-Saving: Quick access to variable information and instant navigation to connected nodes on canvas
  2. Better Organization: Clear overview of variable usage and easy identification of unused variables
  3. Enhanced Workflow: Streamline variable management with automatic selection sync and multiple view options
  4. Project Clarity: Identify unused variables quickly, Focus on specific node selections, Clean up your document by finding hidden layer variables, Get a clear overview with merged or separated collections
  5. Team Efficiency: Share and manage variables across team libraries with intuitive collection organization
  6. Customizable Experience: Multiple view options to match your specific workflow needs
  7. Flexible Export: Export exactly what you need by applying filters, search, and view options before exporting
  8. Canvas Integration: Seamlessly navigate between plugin and canvas with bidirectional node selection


———


Please note:


The plugin is currently in Open Beta, which means it’s open to everyone to try for free during this testing period. This is an opportunity to explore all features, including VariableScout Pro functionalities, at no cost for a limited time.


As this is a beta version, some features might still be refined, and feedback is invaluable in helping improve it before the final release. Thank you for being part of this journey!


Loading collections and mapping variables to nodes for the first time may take longer than subsequent loads. Future loading times will be faster. Loading large collections (>2500 variables and/or 25000 Nodes) may take some time.

plugins.name: Small Image Compressor

A lightweight image compression plugin for Figma that helps designers optimize their exported images.


Key Features (100% Free):

  1. Batch compression and export support
  2. Compatible with JPG, PNG and WebP formats
  3. Multiple compression levels (None/Light/Medium/Extreme)
  4. Various export scales (1x/2x/3x/4x)
  5. Before/after file size comparison
  6. Processing time tracking
  7. Automatic ZIP packaging for multiple files
  8. Suffix toggle switch for exported file names
  9. Smart compression based on image size
  10. Multi-threaded parallel processing
  11. Pure JavaScript implementation with local processing
  12. No usage limits or premium features

plugins.name: Variables2Flutter
plugins.description:
Flutter Code Generator for Figma


Transform your Figma design variables into clean, organized Flutter code effortlessly with the Flutter Code Generator plugin. This powerful tool seamlessly converts your local variables, including Colors, Strings, Numbers, and Booleans, into structured Flutter code, ready to integrate into your development workflow.


Main Features:

- Exports Figma Variables (Color, String, Boolean, Number).

- Exports TextStyles and Shadows, and works with Figma Variables.

- Exports Local Colors, Linear Gradients, and Radial Gradients, all of which work with Figma Variables.

- Generates easily accessible Classes without having to use Context or tools.

- No need to create logic to rebuild the screen when changing from Light to Dark (or the mode that is in the Figma collection).

- Automatically creates documentation when generating the code.

- In addition to having customization options for generating the code.

- AND THE BEST: IT HAS AN ANIMATION EFFECT WHEN SWITCHING THEMES!!!! 😎


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Code Generation: Instantly convert Figma's local variables into Flutter code with just a few clicks.
  2. Variable Support: Includes support for Colors, Strings, Numbers, and Booleans, ensuring a comprehensive export of your design tokens.
  3. Preset Modes: Utilize preset modes to customize how variables are named and categorized in the generated code, matching your project’s naming conventions and coding standards.
  4. Easy Integration: The generated code is organized and ready to be integrated into your Flutter project, streamlining the design-to-development process.
  5. Customizable Naming: Adapt the output to your needs with customizable naming conventions for variables, making the code more intuitive and aligned with your project's requirements.


Quick start:

  1. Open design in figma
  2. Open plugin Variables2Flutter
  3. On the plugin screen, make your adjustments to your preference.
  4. Click in generate
  5. Copy code generate
  6. Open new dart file in your project
  7. Paste code generate
  8. On top of your MaterialApp add FigmaTheme widget
  9. In the Figma Theme widget there are static functions for you to change the "Modes" of the collections' themes.
  10. Each collection will have a get variable in the file for you to retrieve the data, and when the collection changes mode, the widget will rebuild automatically. Example of a get variable:
ColorStylesDefault get ColorStyles {
return _ColorStyles.value;
}


Simplify your design-to-code workflow with the Flutter Code Generator for Figma and enhance your productivity by bridging the gap between design and development.


Tags: Figma, Variables to Flutter, Figma to Flutter, Styles to Flutter, Figma code to Flutter, generate code flutter, figma variables to flutter code, flutter export, convert, theme, styles,FigmaPlugin, Flutter, CodeGenerator, DesignToCode, VariableExport, FlutterDevelopment, FigmaToFlutter, DesignTokens, CodeIntegration, UItoCode, FigmaTools, FlutterUI, DesignSystem, VariableConversion, PluginForDevelopers

plugins.name: EasyTranslate
plugins.description:
Plug the EasyTranslate app into your Figma account and translate your UX and UI design content into any language you need.


Simply trigger the translation process with just a few clicks. As soon as the translations are done, you'll receive them back on Figma in the correct text section, button or whichever design element it belongs to. Switch between languages as often as you need. This way, you can rest assured knowing that your design will look great no matter what language it is in.


The EasyTranslate translation plugin is free of charge and doesn’t require credit card information. There is no time bomb either. You can use the plugin for free for as long as you like.

plugins.name: Translator PRO DeepL
plugins.description:
Translator PRO – the ultimate Figma plugin that revolutionizes design localization! Translate your Figma designs seamlessly while preserving all styles associated with texts and paragraphs using our powerful algorithm.


🌐 Key Features:


Preserve Styles: Our advanced algorithm ensures that your text styles and paragraph formatting stay intact during translation.


Effortless Translation: Quickly translate any free text within your Figma designs with just a few clicks.


Custom Glossaries: Add or delete glossaries to DeepL, enhancing the accuracy of your translations.


Formality Level: Tailor your translations with the ability to choose the desired formality level for your content.



🚀 How to Use:


Install Translator PRO plugin for Figma.


Fill in the plugin account form to get started.


Create an account on DeepL and get your API key : https://www.deepl.com/pro/change-plan#developer


you can profit from 500,000 characters/month for free.


Enter your API key in the plugin settings.


Select the text layers / pages you want to translate

plugins.name: Color Contrast Grid for Figma variables
plugins.description:
Ensure your designs are accessible and inclusive with the power of automated color analysis! The Color Contrast Grid for Figma variables plugin reviews your Figma color variables to create a comprehensive contrast matrix that simplifies accessibility checks.


Key Benefits:

  1. Automatic Variable Scanning: Seamlessly analyzes your Figma color variables, eliminating manual input and making it easy to assess all color combinations in your design system.


  1. Detailed Contrast Ratios: Generates a matrix showing the contrast ratios between background and foreground color variables to identify potential accessibility issues.


  1. AA/AAA Compliance Indicators: Clearly marks which combinations meet WCAG AA and AAA standards, empowering you to meet accessibility guidelines effortlessly.


  1. Color-Coded Visualization: Presents results in an intuitive format, complete with color swatches, text previews, and clear labels for quick identification.


  1. Flexible for any Design System: Handles different variable structures and groups, from small projects to expansive design systems, adapting to your workflow seamlessly.


Ideal for UX/UI designers aiming to build accessible, WCAG-compliant designs with minimal effort and maximum efficiency. Integrate accessibility checks into your design process by harnessing the full power of your Figma variables.


* Current Limitations *

  1. Does not support alpha values
  2. Only supports WCGA color contrast calculations (no support for apca calculations)


I will work on those limitations and hopefully release new versions from time to time that support alpha values, modes and APAC color contrast calculations.
plugins.tagline: Choose colors from your Figma variables to generate a color contrast grid with contrast ratios

plugins.name: Page over
plugins.description:
Improve documentation and project management by sharing links to Pages and Prototype flows with one click. Copy to clipboard and paste anywhere!


Page over is a Figma plugin simplifying your handoff workflow and helping everyone find what they are looking for in your file.


Sort things out from A to Z or the other way around for finding what your are looking for faster. Or add a number to every page and point out the exact numbered page, no matter how many pages you have.


To tidy up the structure and visual hierarchy you can add multiple separator pages in different ASCII styles or even create segments of pages with a click of a button.


Improve your documentation and project management by sharing links to all Pages and/or Prototype flows with a single click while respecting your file's privacy and permissions.


The complete list feature includes:


  • Sorting pages A to Z and Z to A
  • Numbering pages
  • Adding separator (blank pages) with predefined styles
  • Adding multiple pages at once (page segment) with predefined or custom colors
  • Export file anatomy to all Pages and/or Prototype flow with one click


Try the beta release and tell us what you think with a mention to @titanas

accepted.name: Stefanos
accepted.description: Making big little things with meraki.

plugins.tagline: Turnaround your handoff workflow by sorting, numbering, adding page segments. Share page links fast.

plugins.name: fig2tw - Convert variables to Tailwind, CSS or JSON
plugins.description:
Convert Figma variables into a Tailwind plugin, CSS or JSON file.


Key features:

Tailwind configuration is inferred from the variable scopes.

Configure the variable scopes in Figma to generate useful Tailwind configuration.

<div class="bg-primary text-on-primary rounded-sm gap-md p-xs">
The background color is given by the variable "color/primary".
The text color is given by the variable "color/on primary".
The border-radius is given by the variable "radius/sm".
The gap is given by the variable "space/md".
The padding is given by the variable "space/xs".
</div>


All variable modes are converted into CSS variables.

Change the mode (light, dark, etc.) with a CSS class.

<div class="theme-light">Figma's light mode variables are applied here</div>
<div class="theme-dark">Figma's dark mode variables are applied here.</div>


Number units are configured by variable scope.

Define how numbers are to converted to CSS. You can choose from px, em, rem. Font weights don't have units.


Getting started:

1. Download the generated Tailwind plugin

Download the tailwind plugin using the "Download" button and place the file next to your tailwind.config.ts.


2. Import the generated plugin in your Tailwind configuration

In the tailwind.config.ts file, import the generated plugin and place it in the plugins array. The configuration should look like below.

import fig2tw from "tailwind.fig2tw";
const config = {
plugins: [fig2tw],
// ...
}
export default config;


Supports:

Tailwind configuration scopes:

colors, fill, accentColor, backgroundColor, gradientColorStops, borderColor, stroke, ringColor, ringOffsetColor, outlineColor, textColor, textDecorationColor, caretColor, placeholderColor, boxShadowColor.

spacing, size, width, minWidth, maxWidth, height, minHeight, maxHeight, margin, inset, borderRadius, padding, gap, space, scrollMargin, scrollPadding, borderSpacing, strokeWidth, outlineWidth, borderWidth, ringWidth, fontFamily, fontSize, lineHeight, letterSpacing, fontWeight


Figma variables scopes:

ALL_SCOPES, ALL_FILLS, FRAME_FILL, SHAPE_FILL, TEXT_FILL, STROKE_COLOR, EFFECT_COLOR, CORNER_RADIUS, WIDTH_HEIGHT, GAP, STROKE_FLOAT, FONT_SIZE, LINE_HEIGHT, LETTER_SPACING, FONT_WEIGHT, FONT_FAMILY
plugins.tagline: Convert variables into a Tailwind plugin, CSS or JSON

plugins.name: Text Contrast Checker (APCA WCAG3)
plugins.description:
APCA Contrast Checker evaluates text accessibility using the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) for WCAG 3. Unlike traditional WCAG 2 tools, it provides more perceptually accurate assessments by considering font size, weight, and purpose to ensure truly readable designs.


APCA Contrast Checker for WCAG 3

The APCA Contrast Checker plugin brings the next generation of accessibility standards to Figma, implementing the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) developed for WCAG 3 (formerly known as "Silver").


Why APCA Instead of WCAG 2?

Traditional contrast ratios used in WCAG 2 have significant limitations - they treat all color pairs equally regardless of their perceptual differences, often allowing unreadable dark color combinations to "pass" while flagging perfectly readable light combinations as "failures."


APCA solves these problems by:

  1. Accounting for human perception of contrast based on modern vision research
  2. Considering text properties (size, weight, purpose) when determining readability
  3. Providing appropriate contrast levels for different reading scenarios
  4. Delivering more accurate evaluations for both light and dark modes


Key Features

  1. Text Property Analysis: Automatically detects and evaluates font size, weight, and color
  2. Context-Aware Evaluation: Adjusts contrast requirements based on text purpose (body text, headings, UI labels, or non-text elements)
  3. Conformance Levels: Indicates both Bronze (general) and Silver (detailed) level compliance
  4. WCAG 2 Compatibility: Shows approximate WCAG 2 ratio equivalents for reference
  5. Visual Contrast Meter: Displays contrast levels with an intuitive visual indicator
  6. Detailed Recommendations: Provides specific guidance to improve readability
  7. Interactive Controls: Adjust text properties and see results in real-time
  8. Font Size Guidance: Includes minimum font size recommendations based on contrast level and weight


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer in your Figma design
  2. The plugin will automatically evaluate the contrast between the text and its background
  3. Adjust font size, weight, or purpose using the controls to see how they affect compliance
  4. Use the recommendations to improve accessibility
  5. Swap text and background colors with one click to test inverse color schemes


About APCA and Conformance Levels

APCA provides two conformance levels:

  1. Bronze Level: General guidelines suitable for basic contrast evaluation without reference to lookup tables.
  2. Silver Level: More detailed requirements using font size and weight lookup tables for greater accuracy and flexibility.


This plugin implements the full APCA algorithm (Beta 0.1.9 G-4g) and follows the official lookup tables published by Myndex Research, the developers of APCA.


Upgrade your accessibility workflow with perceptually accurate contrast checking that goes beyond simple ratios to ensure your designs are truly readable for all users.
plugins.tagline: Text accessibility, scientifically measured! WCAG3

plugins.name: Figma to Svelte
plugins.description:
The Figma to Svelte plugin is designed to seamlessly generate Svelte code for the Deskblocks design system. It converts selected Figma frames into Svelte code instantly, automatically importing the necessary components from the Deskblocks library.


Key Features

  1. Effortless Code Generation: Converts Figma frames into Svelte code that is ready to use in your Zoho Desk extension project.
  2. Built-in Theming: Deskblocks handles appearance settings (light and dark mode), themes (blue, red, green, orange, yellow), and font selections (Puvi, Lato, Roboto)—"it just works."
  3. AI-Powered Refinement: Optionally use the Claude 3.5 Haiku model to refine the generated code into production-ready quality.


How to Use

  1. Select the Figma frame you want to convert.
  2. Run the plugin to instantly generate Svelte code for the selected frame.
  3. (Optional) Add your Anthropic API key to enable production-ready code generation using Claude 3.5 Haiku.

The generated code is ready to copy and paste into your Zoho Desk extension.


Key Guidelines

  1. Component Naming: Keep the original component names to ensure proper functionality, as the plugin relies on these names for performance.
  2. Autolayout Usage: Use autolayout instead of static frames for better responsive CSS translation.
  3. Radio Button Grouping: Group radio buttons in a separate autolayout (excluding the header) to ensure proper linking in the generated code.


AI Integration

The plugin leverages AI for advanced code refinement. The Claude 3.5 Haiku model is both fast and cost-effective, producing high-quality, production-ready code.

  1. Secure and Local: Your Anthropic API key is stored locally, ensuring privacy and security.
  2. Affordable: Claude 3.5 Haiku costs just $1 per million tokens, making it highly cost-effective—a $10 can support extensive usage.


Note

This is the initial version of the plugin and may have some limitations. Future updates will address these. If you encounter any issues or have suggestions, feel free to provide feedback.
plugins.tagline: Generate clean Svelte code from your Figma files, fully integrated with the Deskblocks design system

plugins.name: Quick Constraints
plugins.description:
Specify constraints with a single command in the quick actions with a keyboard only instead of manually setting constraints through the Figma UI. Just select the objects, enter the command, and the plugin will apply the constraints accordingly.


List of commands

L, R, T, B — Left / Right / Top / Bottom

Alternative: W, A, S, D

V, H, C (or CV, CH) — Center Vertical / Horizontal / Both

SH, SV, SS — Scale Vertical / Horizontal / Both


Quick usage

To quickly open the plugin, use Cmd + K (open quick actions) and search for QC (Quick Constraints), then press Enter and type the command. After typing the command press Enter again to run it.


Examples

WASD — Constrain all sides

VSH — Center Vertical / Scale Horizontal

LR — Left + Right (vertical constraints kept as is)
plugins.tagline: Apply constraints using your keyboard only 🚀

plugins.name: Bitcoin UI Kit
plugins.description:
This is a companion plugin to the Bitcoin UI Kit, which is also published on Figma community. It is specifically made to work with that file.


The primary feature is for easily switching themes with one click. Themes can be color palettes, typography, button styles, and more, and several variations are included in the UI Kit.


Several other helper tools are also included to keep the design system clean and organized:

  • Finding unstyled text
  • Finding component instances
  • Finding instances whose main components are missing or in external files
  • Links to the Bitcoin Design Guide and Bitcoin UI Kit websites for reference
  • Preparing screens for export to bitcoinuikit.com


This is the first iteration of this plugin. Share your feedback on what tools you'd like to see added, and we will add them in.
plugins.tagline: Useful tools for the Bitcoin UI Kit design system.

plugins.name: Tangent Line Tool
plugins.description:
🔍 Plug-in Overview

Tangent Line Tool is an advanced plugin designed for Figma that focuses on creating straight lines that are tangent to existing paths. Whether you are designing interfaces, creating icons or illustrations, this plug-in can significantly improve your productivity and design accuracy. 🛠️


✨ Main features

  1. Two Tangent Modes: Provides two tangent modes to meet different design needs and aesthetic standards.
  2. Efficient real-time preview mode: Immediately view and adjust the tangent effect with the real-time preview function to speed up the design process.
  3. Easy-to-use interface: Intuitive user interface makes creating and adjusting linear paths quick and easy.
  4. High Precision, 100% Fit: Ensures that the created linear path fits perfectly with the existing path, keeping the design precise and consistent.


📌 Introduction to use

  1. Select ellipse 1
  2. Select ellipse 2
  3. Choose the type of tangent you want to generate
  4. Generate new tangent


📩 Contact us

contact us if you have any problem or suggestion: vectorgraphicstool@outlook.com
plugins.tagline: Create two tangent lines for two ellipses.

plugins.name: Tempura Generator
plugins.description:
Download local styles as swift code, and save time.


A lifesaver for developers.

Tempura Generator lets you download local styles as swift code—no more time wasted with annoying typos and boring repetition. Just plug in and play.

When styling specific labels with local styles, Tempura Generator generates the code for the label, so you can paste it immediately into the scene you’re developing.


INSTRUCTIONS


* To download the Color Style catalog, select the Color Style header and click Download Archive. Unzip the downloaded Archive, and copy and paste its contents into the project. You can then access these colors and use them by typing <>


* The same procedure applies for text styles. Select Text Styles, Download File, and copy and paste it into the project. You can then access these text styles by typing <>


* You can generate a code to compose a label inside the UI of a scene by doing the following: Select the label you want to code, then select Code Header in the plugin, make your choices, and click Copy Style.


WHY USE TEMPURA GENERATOR?


Developers are always seeking out ways to save time. Tempura Generator delivers, big-time. As soon as the styles are added to the project, anyone in the team can use it immediately. So if you’re looking for ways to make your team more efficient, Tempura Generator is a must-have.


For example, if the designer changes the accent color from red to yellow, you don’t need to manually make these changes everywhere. Simply re-download the archive, paste its contents into the project, and it will immediately update all the instances of red, with the new yellow.

plugins.name: Currency Formatter
plugins.description:
Currency Formatter


The Currency Formatter plugin simplifies formatting numbers into various currency styles directly within Figma. With just a few clicks, you can ensure your designs are accurate, localized, and visually consistent for different markets.


Key Features

  1. Supports a wide range of global currencies (e.g., $USD, €EUR, ₹INR, £GBP, ¥CNY).
  2. Automatically adds currency symbols and adjusts number formatting.
  3. Live preview of currency formatting directly in your Figma designs.


How It Works

  1. Save your preferred currency in settings.
  2. Use the shortcut `⌘ + P` and type ‘Format Currency’ to apply your settings instantly.


Upcoming Features

  1. Expanded currency support.
  2. Options for decimal formatting.
  3. Flexible choices for symbol positioning and shorthand prefixes.
plugins.tagline: Turn Your Boring Numbers into Fancy Money!

plugins.name: AspectMatic
plugins.description:
AspectMatic is a Figma plugin designed for developers, simplifying aspect ratio calculations. Tired of manual calculations? AspectMatic automates the process.


Features


  1. Separator Options: Choose between colon (:) or slash (/) to format aspect ratios.
  2. Ratio Formats:
  3. Regular Ratio: A simple division format for width and height, such as 300:9 or 300/9.
  4. Reduced Ratio: The simplified version of the regular ratio, like 100:3.
  5. Decimal Form: The ratio expressed as a decimal number, such as 33.33.
  6. Rounded Decimal Form: The decimal ratio rounded to the nearest whole number, such as 33.
  7. Aspect Ratio History: View and manage the history of calculated aspect ratios.
  8. Easy Copy: Quickly copy any aspect ratio to your clipboard for use in your designs.
  9. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive UI designed to streamline the aspect ratio calculation process.


How it works


  1. Select Node(s): Click on one or more nodes in Figma to start the aspect ratio calculation process.
  2. Choose a Separator: Decide whether to use colon (:) or slash (/) as your ratio separator.
  3. Select a Ratio Form: Pick from one of four ratio forms (Regular Ratio, Reduced Ratio, Decimal, or Rounded Decimal).
  4. Generate and Copy: Click Get AR to calculate the aspect ratio(s). Easily copy the results for use in your projects.


Credits


AspectMatic was developed by Emmanuel Jemeni, a frontend developer.


Built with Create Figma Plugin, Preact, TypeScript, Prettier, and TailwindCSS.


If you find this plugin helpful and would like to support my work, feel free to buy me a coffee.


For any contributions or issues, check out the AspectMatic repository.


  1. LinkedIn: Emmanuel Jemeni
  2. GitHub: @Jemeni11
  3. Twitter/X: @Jemeni11_
plugins.tagline: The Figma plugin that helps developers with aspect ratio calculations.

101546.description:
AspectMatic is a Figma plugin designed for developers, simplifying aspect ratio calculations. Tired of manual calculations? AspectMatic automates the process.


Features

  2. Ratio Formats:
  3. Regular Ratio: A simple division format for width and height, such as 300:9 or 300/9.
  4. Reduced Ratio: The simplified version of the regular ratio, like 100:3.
  5. Decimal Form: The ratio expressed as a decimal number, such as 33.33.
  6. Rounded Decimal Form: The decimal ratio rounded to the nearest whole number, such as 33.
  7. Aspect Ratio History: View and manage the history of calculated aspect ratios.
  8. Easy Copy: Quickly copy any aspect ratio to your clipboard for use in your designs.
  9. User-Friendly Interface: Clean and intuitive UI designed to streamline the aspect ratio calculation process.


How it works


  1. Select Node(s): Click on one or more nodes in Figma to start the aspect ratio calculation process.
  2. Choose a Separator: Decide whether to use colon (:) or slash (/) as your ratio separator.
  3. Select a Ratio Form: Pick from one of four ratio forms (Regular Ratio, Reduced Ratio, Decimal, or Rounded Decimal).
  4. Generate and Copy: Click Get AR to calculate the aspect ratio(s). Easily copy the results for use in your projects.


Credits


AspectMatic was developed by Emmanuel Jemeni, a frontend developer.


Built with Create Figma Plugin, Preact, TypeScript, Prettier, and TailwindCSS.


If you find this plugin helpful and would like to support my work, feel free to buy me a coffee.


For any contributions or issues, check out the AspectMatic repository.


  1. LinkedIn: Emmanuel Jemeni
  2. GitHub: @Jemeni11
  3. Twitter/X: @Jemeni11_
101546.release_notes:
Hey. Thank you for using AspectMatic 🎉
Here are the new updates:

1. Major UI Overhaul: AspectMatic now has a cleaner interface that feels more like Figma, and dark mode is here! 🌙

2. New Ratio Formats & Separator Options: In previous versions, AspectMatic only supported displaying aspect ratios as Decimal Form and Rounded Decimal Form (e.g., 1.7777 or 1). Now, AspectMatic includes the familiar Regular Ratio format (e.g., 16:9 or 16/9). Additionally, AspectMatic will reduce the ratio to its simplest form (e.g., from 300:9 to 100:3) for a more refined output. You can also choose between two Separator Options — colon (:) or slash (/).

3. Copy Button Added: AspectMatic now includes a dedicated copy button for quick copying of ratios. No more Ctrl + C! (though you can still do that if you'd like).

4. History Modal: A new history modal lets you view your previous aspect ratios without cluttering the main UI. Your old ratios are neatly stored out of sight, accessible when needed, making the experience much more seamless than the old, ever-growing table.

Thank you again for using and supporting AspectMatic! At the time of writing this note, AspectMatic has 201 users, and I hope each and every one of you love these new updates!
101546.tagline: The Figma plugin that helps developers with aspect ratio calculations.

plugins.name: Handoff Focus
plugins.description:
"Handoff Focus" is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the handoff process between designers and developers. This plugin creates a dedicated handoff page that consolidates all elements marked as "Ready for Development", making it easier for developers to focus on what's ready for implementation.


How to Use


  1. Mark Layers: Use the native Figma feature to mark elements as "Ready for Development."
  2. (optional) Toggle Visibility: Click the visibility icon to hide or show layers based on their development status.
  3. Create Handoff Page: Input a name and click "Create" to generate a handoff page that includes all marked layers.
  4. Customize: Use the "Keep Original Position" option if you want to maintain the original layout of layers on the handoff page.
  5. Review & Share: Once the handoff page is created, review it and share it with developers.


Core Features


  • Visibility Toggle: Options to hide or show layers based on their marked status.
  • Handoff Page Generation: Create a dedicated handoff page with all marked layers.
  • Position Customization: Option to keep the original position of layers on the handoff page.
  • Page Title Annotations: Add page titles to the handoff page for organization. (Disabled when "Keep Original Position" is active.)


Key Benefits


  1. Enhanced Concentration: By hiding non-essential layers, you can zero in on what's crucial, reducing visual noise and enhancing your focus.
  2. Efficiency: No need to manually sift through layers or groups to find what's ready for development. The plugin does the heavy lifting, saving you time and effort.
  3. Collaboration: Makes it easier for designers and developers to collaborate. Developers can quickly view only the layers that are relevant to them, ensuring a smoother handoff process.
  4. Flexibility: Whether you want to hide or show layers, the plugin offers quick toggle options, giving you full control over your workspace visibility.
  5. Lightweight: Designed with performance in mind, "Handoff Focus" ensures a seamless experience even in large documents, without bogging down your Figma app.
plugins.tagline: Highlight ready layers; hide the rest. Streamline your handoff process.

plugins.name: Fill with Rectangle
plugins.description:
Who’d have guessed they’d miss the Fill tool?


How it works:

  1. Select some containers,
  2. run Fill with Rectangle,
  3. get some backgrounds.


Your new rectangles:

  • are placed below other layers or above a mask,
  • get an absolute position inside auto-layout, and
  • will stretch to fit.


That’s it!
